subject: Re: Fw: Test message
msgSnippet: I have all 3 Thoth fonts installed in OS-X.5 - none work for displaying these messages either in my browser (Camino), or in my email program (Mail). ...
messageBody:
I have all 3 Thoth fonts installed in OS-X.5 - none work for
displaying these messages either in my browser (Camino), or in my
email program (Mail).


-----------

Interestingly, your reply replicated my QS text perfectly on my
computer in
Gmail and in my browser on the group message board. Have you loaded
ThothUni font into your computer yet? If not, do so and I think you will
find that you can display it properly then.

Does anyone else with ThothUni installed have any problem with this?

.¥H¥\¥K¥]

Hello again Benct

My previous post was sent via Gmail and I noticed that it scrambled my
signature. However, your "original message" text was displayed
correctly. Reading your message in Windows Mail, i am getting the
square boxes as seen below. I don't really understand this as the
original message was sent through Windows Mail.

Can any of you techies explain this? I would love to be able to post
on a regular basis in QS but only if it is generally readable.

Hi Moira,

I cannot display your message in my email, even though I have Thoth
Unicode installed. If I change the encoding back to plain old Thoth, it
looks like this:

Hs z A test mesiJ jMzN .Antoni gryn'z tekst entri tMl, lompOzd in windMz
mFl. E wont t sI hQ i z displFd in vEriaz mIda.

.mqra

You can cut and paste this in a Word document and see how it appears.
You can see that the first letter is "composed" is Loll rather than
Kick. That means 2 things: First, that my emailer won't display Unicode,
and second, some of the letters are wrong.

Paul

message and I had used Lol instead of Kick.

As to why you cant display, I am hoping that someone techie is going
to find
an answer as this is becoming very irritating. Do you think you could
try a
test message using Anthony's text entry tool to see how it works for
you and
how it is uploaded/downloaded for us?

Moira
